<Link id="l05344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5344"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// callsites within a function that did not also have the strictfp attribute.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5345"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since 10.0, if strict FP semantics are needed within a function, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5347"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// must also have the strictfp attribute. This latter restriction is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// necessary to prevent unwanted libcall simplification when a function is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The &quot;dangling&quot; strictfp attribute usage was only used to prevent constant</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5353"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// callsite has the same effect.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
